titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4856

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KENNON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed.Frankfort, Ky., April 1st, 1864.
Hon. Tho. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.
Dr Sir

Henry Haynes Sheriff of Grayson Co. for year 1862, has paid balance on Revenue for said year, due from said County with Interest and Costs, and now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Ninety Seven 56/100 Dollars (97.56/100), this being the amount of "Damages", adjudged against him for the nonpayment of the revenue due from said county for said year, at the time required by Law_

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Henry Haynes
Shff
Grayson Co
Damages
1st Apl 1864
